295.01 PURPOSE.
   The City hereby establishes the following provisions for the purpose of
providing post-retirement health benefits for employees of the City who were
former members of the Municipal Employees Retirement System, their spouses,
beneficiaries and dependents, and to provide a mechanism of advance funding for
the projected costs of those health benefits.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.02 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, unless a different meaning is clearly required by
the context:
   (a)   "Beneficiary" means any person, except a retiree, who is in receipt of
a retirement allowance, pension or other benefit payable from funds of the
Municipal Employees Retirement System.
   (b)   "City" means the City of Lincoln Park and the Twenty-fifth District
Court.
   (c)   "Controller" means the Controller of the City.
   (d)   "Council" means the Council of the City.
   (e)   "Health benefits" means hospital, medical-surgical and sick-care
benefits for retirees, retirees' spouses, beneficiaries and health insurance
dependents, provided by the City through collective bargaining or otherwise.
   "Health benefits reserve" means the present value of all payments to be made
on account of this chapter, computed upon the basis of such tables of
experience and regular interest as the Controller shall, from time to time,
adopt.
   (g)   "Health insurance dependent" means any of the following:
      (1)   The spouse of the retiree who is not married to the retiree at the
time of the retiree's retirement.
      (2)   The spouse of the retiree who is married to the retiree at the time
of the retiree's death and is not a beneficiary.
      (3)   An unmarried child, by birth or adoption, of a retiree or deceased
member, until the time at which the child attains nineteen years of age.
      (4)   An unmarried child, by birth or adoption, of a retiree or deceased
member, until the time at which the child attains twenty-five years of age, who
is enrolled as a full-time student, and who is or was, at the time of the
retiree's or deceased member's death, a dependent of the retiree or deceased
member as defined in Section 152 of the Internal Revenue Code.
      (5)   An unmarried child, by birth or adoption, of a retiree or deceased
member who is incapable of self-sustaining employment because of mental or
physical handicap, and who is or was, at the time of the retiree's or deceased
member's death, a dependent of the retiree or deceased member as defined in
Section 152 of the Internal Revenue Code.
   (h)   "ME Health Benefits Fund" means the Fund created by this chapter.
   (i)   "Medicaid" means benefits granted under the Federal Medicaid program
established under Title XIX of the Social Security Act.
   (j)   "Medicare" means benefits granted under the Federal Medicare program
established under Title XVIII of the Social Security Act.
   (k)   "Member" means any person included in the membership of the Municipal
Employees Retirement System.
   "Regular interest" means such rate or rates of interest per year, compounded
annually, as the Controller shall, from time to time, determine.
   (m)   "Retiree" means any person who retires with a retirement allowance or
pension payable from funds of the Municipal Employees Retirement System.
   (n)   "Retiree's spouse" means the person to whom the retiree is married at
the time of the retiree's retirement during the life of the retiree, as long as
he or she remains the spouse of the retiree.
   (o)   "Retirement" means a person's withdrawal from rendering personal
services to the City, with a retirement allowance or pension granted according
to the provisions of the Municipal Employees Retirement System.
   (p)   "Treasurer" means the Treasurer of the City.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.03 ADMINISTRATION BY CONTROLLER; RESPONSIBILITIES OF TREASURER AND CITY
ATTORNEY.
   (a)   The Controller is vested with the general administration, management
and responsibility for the proper operation of the ME Health Benefits Fund and
for administering the provisions of this chapter.
   (b)   The Treasurer shall be the custodian of the ME Health Benefits Fund.
All payments from the ME Health Benefits Fund shall be made by the Treasurer
only upon proper authorization of the Controller. The Treasurer shall maintain
a separate account or accounts at a banking institution, which account or
accounts shall be identified as the ME Health Benefits Fund for the City.
   (c)   The City Attorney shall be the legal advisor regarding the ME Health
Benefits Fund. The City Attorney may, subject to the approval of Council,
obtain legal assistance from legal counsel having additional experience
regarding the ME Health Benefits Fund and related matters.
   (d)   The Controller shall appoint an actuary who shall be the Controller's
health benefits technical advisor on matters regarding the operation of the ME
Health Benefits Fund and who shall perform such other duties as are required in
connection therewith. The Controller's health benefits technical advisor's
compensation for such services shall be fixed by the Controller, subject to the
approval of Council, and shall be paid from the expense account.
   (e)   The Controller shall, subject to the approval of Council, employ such
persons as are required for the proper operation of this chapter. The
compensation for such services shall be fixed by the Controller, subject to the
approval of Council, and be paid from the expense account.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.04 RECORDS AND REPORTS.
   The Controller shall keep or cause to be kept, in a convenient form, such
data as shall be necessary for an actuarial valuation of the ME Health Benefits
Fund. The Controller shall render a report to Council, on or before the first
day in October of each year, showing the fiscal transactions involving the ME
Health Benefits Fund for the year ending the preceding thirtieth of June, and
the last balance sheet showing the financial condition of the ME Health
Benefits Fund by means of an actuarial valuation of the assets and liabilities
of the ME Health Benefits Fund. All records and reports created or maintained
pursuant to or in furtherance of this chapter shall be public records open to
public inspection at all reasonable times and places. Quarterly reports shall
be provided upon request of Council or the Mayor.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.05 MORTALITY AND EXPERIENCE TABLES.
   The Controller shall adopt such mortality, service, inflation and other
tables of experience as are required in the operation of the ME Health Benefits
Fund on an actuarial basis, after receipt of the actuary's written
recommendations.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.06 PAYMENT OF HEALTH BENEFITS TO RETIREE AND BENEFICIARIES.
   (a)   Effective July 1, 1993, the Controller shall pay from the funds
provided by this chapter the entire monthly premium or membership or
subscription fee for hospital, medical, surgical and sick-care benefits for any
retiree, retiree's spouse or beneficiary who elects coverage in the plan
authorized by the City.
   (b)   Effective July 1, 1993, the Controller may pay from the funds provided
by this chapter up to the maximum amount payable under subsection (a) hereof
toward the monthly premium for hospital, medical-surgical and sick-care
benefits for a retiree, retiree's spouse or beneficiary enrolled in a group
health insurance or prepaid service plan not authorized by the City, for whom
the Municipal Employees Retirement System, on the day prior to the effective
date of this section, was responsible for making a payment towards his or her
monthly premium.
   (c)   The payments provided for by this section shall not be made on behalf
of a Municipal Employees Retirement System nonduty death beneficiary if such
beneficiary remarries or becomes employed and receives health benefits from any
other source.
   (d)   Any retiree, retiree's spouse, beneficiary or health insurance
dependent excluded from payments under this section may participate in the
hospital, medical-surgical and sick-care benefits plan described in this
section at his or her own cost.
   (e)   The hospital, medical-surgical and sick-care benefits plan that covers
retirees, retirees' spouses, beneficiaries and health insurance dependents
provided by the City shall contain a coordination of benefits provision
providing for priority payment of benefits consistent with all of the
following:
      (1)   If the person covered under the hospital, medical-surgical and
sick-care benefits plan is also eligible for Medicare or Medicaid, or both,
then the benefits under Medicare or Medicaid, or both, shall be determined
before the benefits for the hospital, medical-surgical and sick-care benefits
plan provided by the City are determined.
      (2)   If the person covered under the hospital, medical-surgical and
sick-care benefits plan is also covered under another plan that contains a
coordination of benefits provision, the benefits shall be coordinated as
provided by the Coordination of Benefits Act, Act 64 of the Public Acts of
1984, as amended (M.C.L.A. 550.251 et seq.).
      (3)   If the person covered under the hospital, medical-surgical and
sick-care benefits plan is also covered under another plan that does not
contain a coordination of benefits provision, the benefits under the other plan
shall be determined before the benefits of the plan provided by the City are
determined.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.07 CITY SUBROGATED TO RIGHTS OF THIRD PARTIES.
   In the event a person becomes entitled to health benefits payable from funds
provided pursuant to this chapter, as a result of an accident or injury caused
by the act of a third party, the City shall be subrogated to the rights of such
person against such third party to the extent of the health benefits which the
City pays or becomes liable to pay.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.08 ME HEALTH BENEFITS FUND.
   (a)   The ME Health Benefits Fund is hereby established. This Fund shall be
the Fund to which appropriations of the City for health benefits are credited,
in which shall be accumulated reserves for the payment of all health benefits
payable from funds provided by the City and from which shall be paid all health
benefits as provided by this chapter. Upon the basis of such mortality and
other experience tables and regular interest as the Controller shall from time
to time adopt, the actuary shall annually compute the health benefits reserves
for:
      (1)   Health benefits being paid to retirees, retirees' spouses,
beneficiaries and health insurance dependents, and
      (2)   Covering health benefits accruing to and to be accrued by members.
   Such health benefits reserves shall be financed by annual appropriations, to
be made by Council and paid by the City, as determined according to subsections
(b) and (c) hereof, subject to subsection (d) hereof.
   (b)   The appropriation for members currently accruing health benefits shall
be determined using a generally acceptable method of actuarial valuation.
Unfunded accrued health benefits shall be amortized over a period of years to
be determined by the Controller after receipt of the actuary's written
recommendations.
   (c)   The appropriation for health benefits being paid to retirees,
retirees' spouses, beneficiaries and health insurance dependents shall be a
percentage of the City's annual employee payroll, excluding police and fire
personnel not covered by this chapter, which will produce an amount which, if
paid annually by the City over a period of years, to be determined by the
Controller, will amortize, at regular interest, the unfunded health benefits
reserves for health benefits being paid retirees, retirees' spouses,
beneficiaries and health insurance dependents.
   (d)   Notwithstanding the foregoing, Council shall appropriate a base amount
of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) for health benefits for the fiscal year
beginning July 1, 1991. Thereafter, Council shall appropriate for each
succeeding fiscal year for health benefits a base amount equal to 110 percent
of the previous year's base appropriation for health benefits. In addition to
the base appropriations required by this subsection, Council shall, for each
fiscal year beginning July 1, 1993, appropriate an additional amount equal to
the City's actual cost to provide for health benefits for that fiscal year for
retirees, retirees' spouses, beneficiaries and health insurance dependents,
said amounts to be credited to the reserve for the ME Health Benefits Fund.
Both the base and additional annual appropriations required by this subsection
shall cease when said annual appropriations are equal to the appropriations
required by subsections (b) and (c) hereof, at which time all future
appropriations shall be made in accordance with subsections (b) and (c) hereof.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.09 EXPENSE ACCOUNT.
   The expense account shall be the subaccount of the ME Health Benefits Fund,
to which shall be credited all money provided by the City to pay the
administration expense of this chapter, and from which shall be paid all
expenses necessary in connection with the administration of this chapter. The
Controller shall annually certify to Council, on or before the first Monday in
May, according to legal budget procedure established by the City, the amount of
appropriations necessary to administer this chapter during the ensuing fiscal
year, and the City shall appropriate such amounts to the credit of the expense
account. Investment earnings of the ME Health Benefits Fund may be used to pay
reasonable expenses of administration of this chapter, which amount shall be
reimbursed by the City.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.10 INVESTMENT OF FUNDS.
   (a)   The Controller shall have full power to invest and reinvest the ME
Health Benefits Fund and expense account subject to applicable law.
   (b)   The Controller shall have full power to hold, purchase, sell, assign,
transfer and dispose of any of the securities and investments in which any part
of the ME Health Benefits Fund has been invested, as well as the proceeds of
such investments and any moneys belonging to the ME Health Benefits Fund.
   (c)   The ME Health Benefits Fund and expense account shall be held for the
sole purpose of meeting disbursements for health benefits and the
administration expense of this chapter, respectively, and shall be used for no
other purpose. The descriptions of the ME Health Benefits Fund and expense
account in Sections
295.08 and
295.09 shall be interpreted to refer to the accounting records of the ME Health
Benefits Fund and expense account and shall not be construed as requiring
actual segregation of the moneys in the ME Health Benefits Fund.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.11 INTEREST EARNINGS.
   All interest and other earnings on moneys and investments of the ME Health
Benefits Fund shall be credited to the ME Health Benefits Fund.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.12 EXCLUSIVE BENEFIT AND SEPARATE FUND.
   The provisions of this chapter and the ME Health Benefits Fund shall be
construed to be a fund separate and distinct from the City and all other
agencies and funds of the City. The assets of the ME Health Benefits Fund shall
be held for the express purpose of providing health benefits for the exclusive
benefit of employees, retirees, retirees' spouses, beneficiaries and health
insurance dependents pursuant to this chapter, and the administration expense
of this chapter, and no part thereof may be diverted for any other purpose. No
part of the assets of the ME Health Benefits Fund shall revert to the City
prior to the satisfaction of all liabilities under this chapter to provide
health benefits to employees, retirees, retirees' spouses, beneficiaries and
health insurance dependents. The City shall immediately offer each collective
bargaining unit a contract provision or a memorandum of understanding which
incorporates this chapter as a collective bargaining agreement provision.
Subject to Section
295.15, no substantive changes to this chapter may be made without the approval
of all applicable collective bargaining units.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.13 ASSIGNMENT, GARNISHMENT, ATTACHMENT OF BENEFITS, ETC. PROHIBITED.
   The right of a person to health benefits, any other right accrued or
accruing to any member, retiree, retiree's spouse, beneficiary or health
insurance dependent under the provisions of this chapter, and the moneys
belonging to the ME Health Benefits Fund, shall not be subject to execution,
garnishment, attachment, the operation of bankruptcy or insolvency law, or any
other process of law whatsoever, and shall be unassignable, provided, however,
that the City shall have the right to set-off for any claim arising for
embezzlement by or fraud of a member, retiree, retiree's spouse, beneficiary or
health insurance dependent.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.14 ADJUSTMENTS FOR ERRONEOUS PAYMENTS.
   Should any change or error in the records created or maintained pursuant to
or in furtherance of this chapter result in any retiree, retiree's spouse,
beneficiary or health insurance dependent receiving from the ME Health Benefits
Fund more or less than would have been received had the records been correct,
the Controller shall correct such error and, as far as is practicable, shall
adjust the amount of the health care benefit in such manner that the equivalent
of the benefit to which such retiree, retiree's spouse, beneficiary or health
insurance dependent was correctly entitled shall be paid.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.15 VEBA OR OTHER ACCOUNT VEHICLE.
   The City, with the concurrence of Council, may establish a Voluntary
Employee Benefit Association (VEBA) or other account vehicle which provides for
the identical substantive terms of this chapter if, in the opinion of the
Controller and the City Attorney, such VEBA or other account vehicle has
investment or other advantages superior to the ME Health Benefits Fund
established by this chapter.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
295.16 COLLECTIVELY BARGAINED HEALTH BENEFITS.
   In the event of a conflict between the health benefits referred to in this
chapter and the benefits provided by the terms of the collective bargaining
agreements of the City, the terms of the collective bargaining agreements shall
control.
(Res. 94-717. Passed 12-19-94.)
