Ch. 810
844.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Kiddie land" means an area within which one or more kiddie rides are
operated.
   (b)   "Kiddie ride" means a device, including an animal, which is operated
out-of-doors primarily for the purpose of giving rides to children who are
twelve years of age or under, but not including rides that may be coin-
operated.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.010)
844.02 LICENSE REQUIRED; SUSPENSION AUTHORITY.
   No person shall operate or maintain, directly or indirectly, in the City, a
kiddie ride or kiddie land without first obtaining a license therefor from the
Mayor and Council. Council may, at any time, suspend such license after a
hearing for a violation of any of the provisions of this chapter or any other
ordinance of the City or statute of the State.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.020)
844.03 LICENSE TERM; FEES.
   (a)   All licenses granted under this chapter shall expire on the second
Tuesday of May in each year.
   (b)   The annual fee for such license for a kiddie land shall be one hundred
fifty dollars ($150.00), plus twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for each kiddie ride
in the kiddie land. No reduction in the fee shall be made for fractional yearly
licenses.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.030)
844.04 INSURANCE.
   No license shall be issued until the applicant therefor supplies to the City
a copy of a liability insurance policy in the minimum amount of one hundred
thousand dollars ($100,000) on each person and three hundred thousand dollars
($300,000) for each occurrence. The policy shall, in addition thereto, save the
City harmless from any liability arising out of the maintenance or operation of
the kiddie land. The policy may not be cancelled except upon ten days written
notice to the City.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.040)
844.05 LOCATION RESTRICTIONS.
   No license may be issued for a kiddie land that is to be located within 250
feet of a church, school or residence in the City. However, the distance
requirement may be waived upon written consent of fifty-one percent of the
adult residents living within 250 feet of the proposed kiddie land.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.050)
844.06 FENCES.
   Every kiddie land must be enclosed by a cyclone-type steel mesh fence at
least three feet in height.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.060)
844.07 CERTIFICATION OF RIDE SAFETY; EXPERIENCED OPERATORS.
   (a)   Each kiddie ride must be maintained in a safe and nonhazardous
operating condition at all times. No license for any such ride may be granted
until the Chief of Police certifies, in writing, that the ride is in a safe
operating condition.
   (b)   There must be in attendance, at all times the kiddie land is in
operation, at least one experienced operator for each ride.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.070)
844.08 HOURS OF OPERATION.
   Any licensee under this chapter will limit the hours of operation of the
kiddie land from 10:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., Monday through Saturday, and from 1:
00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. on Sunday.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.080)
844.09 OPERATION ON PARKING LOTS.
   If an applicant for a license required by this chapter desires to operate a
kiddie land on property presently being used as an automobile parking lot, the
application must be accompanied by a written statement from the Superintendent
of the Building Department that such use will not reduce the number of parking
spaces below that required by the Zoning Code.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.090)
844.10 COIN-OPERATED DEVICES PROHIBITED.
   No coin-operated devices of any type shall be permitted in any kiddie land.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.14.100)
844.11 EXCEPTIONS TO CHAPTER.
   This chapter shall not apply to any amusement or entertainment conducted
under the supervision of:
   (a)   Any public or parochial school, any church or the City, and
organizations under the control or direction of, or supported in whole or in
part by, any such school, church or the City;
   (b)   The Young Men's Christian Association;
   (c)   The Young Women's Christian Association;
   (d)   Any fraternal society when such amusement is open to members only, and
not open to the public; or
   (e)   Religious services of any kind.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.06.010)
844.99 PENALTY AND SANCTIONS FOR MUNICIPAL CIVIL INFRACTIONS.
   Whoever violates the provisions of this chapter shall be subject to the
penalty and sanctions for Municipal civil infractions as provided in Section
202.101 of the Administration Code.
(Res. 03-57A. Passed 1-27-03.)

1294.33
848.01 MASSAGE PARLOR DEFINED.
   As used in this chapter, "massage parlor" means any building, room, place or
establishment, other than a regularly licensed hospital or dispensary, where
nonmedical and nonsurgical manipulative exercises are practiced upon the human
body for other than cosmetic or beautifying purposes, with or without the use
of mechanical or bathing devices, by anyone who is not a physician or surgeon
or of a similarly registered status.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.010)
848.02 LICENSES REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person shall operate a massage parlor without first obtaining a
license therefor.
   (b)   No owner or conductor of any massage parlor shall employ any person to
engage in the practice of massage unless such person is a licensed operator or
registered apprentice, as provided for in this chapter.
   (c)   No person shall engage in the practice of massage without first
obtaining a license therefor.
   (d)   No person shall be an instructor of the practice of massage without
first obtaining a license therefor.
848.03 CERTIFICATES OF APPROVAL.
   The applicant for a license under this chapter shall file with the Health
Officer a written application, under oath, on a form prescribed and supplied by
the Health Officer, and shall submit satisfactory proof of the required age,
educational qualifications and good moral character, as provided in this
chapter. If such applicant is qualified, he or she shall receive a certificate
of approval from the Health Officer, a copy of which certificate shall be
delivered to the license collector with the license application and the license
fee.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.030)
848.04 LICENSE FEES.
   (a)   The annual license fee for a massage practitioner shall be ten dollars
($10.00), and for each owner or operator of a massage parlor, fifty dollars
($50.00) for each such establishment.
   (b)   The annual license fee for an instructor of the practice of massage
shall be ten dollars ($10.00) for each such instructor.
   (c)   All license fees paid under this chapter shall be credited to the
General Fund of the City.
848.05 QUALIFICATIONS OF APPLICANTS.
   Applicants for licenses under this chapter shall meet the following
qualifications:
   (a)   An apprentice or student shall be at least eighteen years of age and
of good moral character and shall have an education equivalent to the
completion of grammar school.
   (b)   An operator shall be at least twenty years of age and of good moral
character, shall have an education equivalent to the completion of grammar
school and shall have not less than one year of practice under the supervision
of a registered operator or instructor as an apprentice or shall have graduated
from a licensed training school. Operators' licenses shall be granted only to
those persons who are able to pass the examination arranged by the Health
Officer and whose course of instruction meets with his or her approval.
   (c)   The owner or conductor of any massage parlor shall be of good moral
character or, if a corporation, its officers shall be of good moral character.
The premises on which such establishment is located shall be sanitary and
suitable for the conduct of such business.
   (d)   The owner or conductor of a school (and if a corporation, its
officers) for the practice of massage shall be of good moral character. The
premises on which such school is to be conducted shall be sanitary and suitable
for the purpose and shall meet the approval of the Health Officer as to the
sanitary condition.
   (e)   An instructor in a school for the practice of massage shall be of good
moral character, shall be a graduate of a grammar school, shall have been a
licensed operator for at least one year and shall pass an examination given in
accordance with the rules and regulations of the Health Officer, as provided in
this chapter.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.050)
848.06 DISPLAY OF LICENSES.
   All license certificates issued under this chapter shall be displayed by the
licensee at or near the place where such licensee is engaging in the practice
or occupation for which he or she has obtained a license.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.070)
848.07 LICENSE ISSUANCE; CONDITIONS FOR REVOCATION.
   (a)   The Mayor and Council are authorized to issue licenses upon
application therefor, refuse to issue licenses or revoke the same if it is
determined, upon satisfactory proof, that the applicant is not qualified, as
provided by this chapter, or is not the proper or suitable person to conduct or
engage in the practice of massage, or that the applicant has violated any of
the rules of the Health Officer or has been convicted of a felony or of a
violation of any of the laws of the State or the City with reference to
alcoholic beverages, drugs, sanitation or prostitution.
   (b)   Failure to conform with the rules and regulations of the Health
Officer and with this chapter shall be considered sufficient cause for a
request to the Mayor and Council by the Health Officer for the revocation of
the license.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.080)
848.08 EXAMINATIONS; CERTIFICATIONS.
   (a)   Before the Mayor and Council issue any license for the practice of
massage or the operation of a massage parlor, the application shall be referred
to the Health Officer who shall examine the qualifications and fitness of the
applicant. The Health Officer shall, after examination, certify his or her
approval or disapproval of the applicant. If he or she disapproves of the
applicant, he or she shall state, in writing, his or her reasons therefor, and
shall give a copy of such reasons to the Mayor and Council and the applicant.
   (b)   Such examination shall be in accordance with the rules adopted by the
Health Officer. The examination may include practical demonstrations and oral
or written tests consistent with the practical and theoretical requirements of
the occupation.
   (c)   If the owner of a massage parlor intends to personally attend patrons,
he or she shall pass the examination for an operator as arranged by the Health
Officer.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.090)
848.09 CONDITIONS FOR ISSUANCE OF OWNERS' LICENSES.
   A license required by this chapter shall be issued to the owner of a massage
parlor if he or she agrees to conform to the rules and regulations set forth in
this chapter and to employ as operators only persons who are licensed by the
Health Officer under this chapter. The license shall be granted only after an
inspection has been made by a representative of the Health Officer and after
the type, location and sanitary condition of the premises and equipment have
been approved.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.100)
848.10 INSPECTIONS.
   Every massage parlor shall, at reasonable business hours, be held open for
inspection by duly authorized representatives of City departments concerned
with the licensing and supervision of such establishments. The Health Officer
shall have general sanitary supervision thereof. Moral supervision of the same
shall be directed by the Police Chief.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.110)
848.11 REGISTRATION OF APPRENTICES AND STUDENTS.
   (a)   Apprentices or students shall, upon entering the practice of massage,
register with the Health Officer, and shall be subject to the rules and
regulations of the Health Officer. They shall be given a certificate of
registration which shall be displayed in or near the place where such student
or apprentice is engaged.
   (b)   No apprentice will receive registration from the Health Officer unless
he or she is receiving his or her training in a school licensed under this
chapter or is now employed in an establishment under the instruction of a
licensed operator.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.130)
848.12 RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Posting. The Health Officer shall cause copies of the rules and
regulations provided for by this chapter to be printed and furnished to
licensees under this chapter. Every licensee shall cause such rules and
regulations to be placed in a public place in each establishment or shop
regulated by this chapter.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.120)
   (b)   Generally. Licensees under this chapter shall be subject to the
following rules and regulations:
      (1)   Service in massage parlors licensed under this chapter shall be
limited to exercise, baths and massage. Medical treatment of any kind shall not
be given to any patron without a prescription from a registered physician. The
use of heat lamps and sunray lamps only will be permitted.
      (2)   No person who has any visible symptoms of a communicable disease,
such as a rash, discharge or fever, or who is complaining of a sore throat, may
be attended by any licensee under this chapter or by any person engaged in the
practice of massage.
      (3)   Serving or attending in a massage parlor of patrons of the opposite
sex is prohibited, provided that this provision shall not apply in cases in
which such serving or attending is under the supervision of a licensed
physician, surgeon or osteopath.
      (4)   Each applicant for a license under this chapter shall present a
certificate from a registered physician certifying that he or she is free from
communicable disease.
      (5)   Advertising that there is a nurse in attendance is prohibited
unless there is a registered graduate nurse constantly in attendance during the
business hours of the massage parlor.
      (6)   Advertising that there is a doctor in attendance is prohibited
unless there is a registered physician constantly in attendance during the
business hours of the massage parlor.
      (7)   Licensees shall exercise every precaution for the safety of
patrons. They shall watch for early signs of fatigue or weakness and shall
immediately discontinue whatever form of service is being given upon the
appearance of such signs.
      (8)   No massage parlor shall be conducted in direct connection with
living quarters, unless especially approved by the Health Officer.
      (9)   The premises used for a massage parlor shall be well lighted and
ventilated. They shall be kept clean and the furniture and equipment shall be
maintained in a safe and sanitary condition. There shall be an adequate supply
of running hot and cold water during business hours. Bathing devices shall be
thoroughly cleaned before the use of each patron.
      (10)   All robes, towels, blankets and linens furnished for the use of
one patron shall be thoroughly laundered before being offered to another.
      (11)   Uniforms or garments worn by an owner, instructor, operator or
apprentice while attending patrons shall be of washable material and shall be
kept in clean condition. The sleeves shall not reach below the elbow.
      (12)   The skin of the hands of persons attending patrons shall be clean
and in healthy condition and the nails shall be kept short.
      (13)   Licensees shall be restricted in the exercise of their license to
the places set forth in their certificate, except that the giving of massage,
baths and exercise in the patron's place of residence is permitted.
      (14)   Licensees shall notify the Health Officer of any change of name or
address of their homes or business.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.82.140)
848.99 PENALTY AND SANCTIONS FOR MUNICIPAL CIVIL INFRACTIONS.
   Whoever violates the provisions of this chapter shall be subject to the
penalty and sanctions for Municipal civil infractions as provided in Section
202.101 of the Administration Code.
(Res. 03-57A. Passed 1-27-03.)
CHAPTER 850
Mechanical Amusement Device Arcades

   CROSS REFERENCES
   Opening or attempting to open coin-operated devices - see M.C.L.A. Secs.
750.113, 752.811, 752.812
   Slugs - see M.C.L.A. Secs. 752.801 et seq.
   Licensing in general - see B.R. & T.
Ch. 802
   Carnivals, circuses and exhibitions - see B.R. & T.
Ch. 810
   Coin machines in kiddie lands - see B.R. & T.
844.10
   Mechanical amusement devices - see B.R. & T.
Ch. 852
   Registration of businesses, trades and industries - see B.R. & T.
Ch. 866
850.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Mechanical amusement device" has the same meaning set forth in
Section
852.01.
   (b)   "Mechanical amusement device arcade" means any premises open to the
public wherein are assembled more than five mechanical amusement devices or
video games, or a combination thereof.
(Res. 82-315. Passed 4-19-82.)
   (c)   "Amusement arcade" means any place of business in which film or video
viewing services or devices or booths are located for the use of the
entertainment of a person or persons patronizing the place of business.
"Amusement arcade" does not include hotels and motels.
   (d)   "Film or video viewing device" means any electrical or mechanical
device which projects or displays any film or videotape or reproduction, the
temporary use of which is contingent upon the payment of some consideration,
and which use is to occur upon the premises where the device is located.
   (e)   "Booth" means an enclosure used by a patron to observe live conduct by
male(s) or female(s), the temporary use of which is contingent upon the payment
of some consideration, and which use is to occur upon the premises where the
booth is located.
   (f)   "Video game" has the same meaning as is set forth in Section
852.01.
   (g)   "Owner" means any person holding any proprietary interest in the
premises housing a mechanical amusement device arcade or amusement arcade.
(Res. 91-184. Passed 4-8-91.)
850.02 LICENSE REQUIRED; COMPLIANCE.
   (a)   No person shall establish or operate, or cause to be established or
operated, any mechanical amusement device arcade or amusement arcade, except in
conformity with this chapter and all other applicable ordinances.
   (b)   No person shall establish or operate a mechanical amusement device
arcade unless the arcade or amusement arcade is licensed in accordance with
this chapter.
(Res. 91-184. Passed 4-8-91.)
850.03 LICENSE APPLICATION; AFFIDAVIT.
   (a)   Any person, business, corporation or partnership desiring a license to
establish and operate a mechanical amusement device arcade or an amusement
arcade must comply in all respects with all ordinances relating to mechanical
amusement devices, film or video viewing devices, booths, and video games and
shall make application for such license upon forms established by the City
Clerk.
   (b)   The prospective licensee shall submit a sworn affidavit stating that
he or she, or, if a corporation or partnership, it, desires to operate a
mechanical amusement device or arcade or an amusement arcade, the proposed
location thereof and the number of mechanical amusement devices and/or film or
video viewing devices and/or booths and/or video games which will be contained
therein.
(Res. 91-184. Passed 4-8-91.)
850.04 INVESTIGATIONS.
   All applications for licenses under this chapter shall be filed with the
City Clerk and transmitted to Council. Upon receipt of such application,
Council, before acting upon it, may refer the same for investigation to the
Building Department, Police Department and/or the Treasurer's Office, which
shall report to Council within a reasonable time, and not more than thirty days
thereafter. If, upon receipt of such application, or, if referred to the
aforesaid departments, it is found that the applicant and/or the building or
premises, upon which the aforesaid juvenile mechanical amusement devices,
mechanical amusement devices, film or video viewing devices, booths, or video
games, are to be housed, conform to the Zoning Code and/or the Building Code
and that the applicant has paid all appropriate real or personal property taxes
to the City, Council shall grant such license to the applicant upon payment to
the City Treasurer of the fees prescribed in this chapter.
(Res. 91-257. Passed 4-29-91.)
850.05 LICENSE FEE; EXPIRATION.
   (a)   The annual fee for the establishment and operation of a mechanical
amusement device arcade shall be seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00), plus an
additional fifty dollars ($50.00) per year per mechanical amusement device or
video game.
(Res. 82-315. Passed 4-19-82.)
   (b)   Licenses issued pursuant to this chapter shall expire on the first
Tuesday of May of each year unless sooner revoked.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.12.050)
850.06 LICENSE ISSUANCE; RESTRICTIONS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section
850.06 was repealed by Resolution 91-184, passed April 8, 1991.)
850.07 DISORDERLY PERSONS; GAMBLING; PEACE DISTURBANCES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Section
850.07 was repealed by Resolution 91-184, passed April 8, 1991.)
850.08 VISIBILITY OF INTERIOR; FILM OR VIDEO VIEWING DEVICE SPECIFICATIONS AND
REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Any amusement arcade containing film or video viewing devices or
booths shall comply with the requirements of subsection (b) hereof if the
material exhibited by the devices or the live conduct observed by means and use
of the booths depicts, contains or includes any of the following elements:
      (1)   Vaginal or anal intercourse between persons, regardless of sex;
      (2)   Sexual contact between humans and animals;
      (3)   Masturbation, whether of another or one's self;
      (4)   Oral sex, real or simulated;
      (5)   Graphic depiction of human excretory functions;
      (6)   Fondling or other erotic touching of the genitalia, pubic region,
buttocks, anus or female breasts of another or of one's self; or
      (7)   Specified anatomical areas, defined as:
         A.   Less than completely and opaquely covered;
            1.   Human genitalia and/or pubic region;
            2.   Buttocks, anus; or
            3.   Female breast below a point immediately above the top of the
areola;
         B.   Human male genitals in a discernibly turgid state, even if
completely and opaquely covered.
   (b)   Each and every viewing booth for all film or video devices or live
conduct must comply with all of the following:
      (1)   It must be visible from a well-illuminated continuous main aisle;
      (2)   It shall not be obscured by any curtain, door or other enclosure;
      (3)   All side or rear walls must be without holes or openings;
      (4)   It shall not be occupied by more than one patron at a time; and
      (5)   It shall be illuminated by a light bulb of a wattage of no less
than twenty-five watts.
   (c)   No owner, operator, employee or agent of an amusement arcade shall
violate this section and/or allow and/or permit a violation thereof to occur.
   (d)   No patron of an amusement arcade shall violate paragraph (b)(4)
hereof.
(Res. 91-184. Passed 4-8-91.)
850.09 SECURITY GUARDS AND ADULT SUPERVISION.
   A mechanical amusement device arcade consisting of ten or more mechanical
amusement devices or video games, or a combination thereof, shall not be open
for business between the hours of 6:00 p.m. and 2:00 a.m. on weekdays, and at
all hours of operation on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays, without a licensed
security guard on the premises. A licensed security guard shall not be required
between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. on weekdays, provided that an
adult supervisor is on the premises. An additional licensed security guard
shall be required for each additional twenty mechanical amusement devices or
video games, or combination thereof, during the hours when a licensed security
guard is required. An additional adult supervisor shall be required for each
additional twenty mechanical amusement devices or video games, or combination
thereof, during the hours when an adult supervisor is required.
(Res. 82-315. Passed 4-19-82.)
850.10 HOURS OF OPERATION.
   No mechanical amusement device arcade or amusement arcade shall be open for
business between the hours of 2:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m.
(Res. 91-281. Passed 5-6-91.)
850.11 LICENSE REVOCATION.
   Any license issued under this chapter by the City may be revoked or
suspended after notice and a hearing for good cause, or where any of the
provisions of this chapter or
Chapter 852 are violated, or where any agent, servant or employee of the
licensee engages in, permits or knowingly acquiesces to any conduct which
violates any of the provisions of this chapter or
Chapter 852.
(Res. 91-184. Passed 4-8-91.)
850.12 EXCEPTIONS TO CHAPTER.
   This chapter shall not apply to any amusement conducted under the
supervision of:
   (a)   Any public or parochial school, any church or the City, and
organizations under the control or direction of, or supported in whole or in
part by, any such school or church or the City;
   (b)   The Young Men's Christian Association;
   (c)   The Young Women's Christian Association;
   (d)   Any fraternal society when such amusement is open to members only, and
not open to the public; or
   (e)   Religious services of any kind.
(1979 Code Sec. 5.06.010)
850.99 PENALTY AND SANCTIONS FOR MUNICIPAL CIVIL INFRACTIONS.
   Whoever violates the provisions of this chapter shall be subject to the
penalty and sanctions for Municipal civil infractions as provided in Section
202.101 of the Administration Code.
(Res. 03-57A. Passed 1-27-03.)
